title: Biologia della Conservazione
text: Welcome to class! These web-pages contain all the information you need to accomplish your class work for Biologia della Conservazione.

title: Contact information
text:

title: Biologia della Conservazione
text:
Learning objectives
The course aims at providing students with the most fundamental tools to understand, acknowledge, describe, and address problems related to the conservation of Biodiversity. By the end of the course the students should develop autonomy in the process of understanding of different approaches and methods, consolidating the awareness that conservation biology is a crisis discipline that requires specific analytical skills to guide appropriate interventions.
Students are expected to develop professional language and communication skills through a continuous interaction with the teacher and interventions during classes. Additionally, students are guided in the understanding of the discipline through the access to primary literature in English. The process of development such skills is monitored by written periodical checks, with open questions.






Note



Attendance is mandatory!








Read carefully!



It is a student’s responsibility to periodically check this website to make sure he/she has the most updated information about the course schedule and content. The dates for the mid term and final exams will be published on this website later during the course of the semester!





The course will begin on Thursday March 14. This tenttive schedule for mid-terms and final exams will be updated throughout the course.

title: Biologia della Conservazione
text:
Topics outline

Introduction to Conservation Biology
An historical perspective on Conservation Biology. A crisis discipline, from


Biodiversity and Extinctions


Populations


Conservation genetics


Conservation and climate change


Conservation technology


Conservation economics
